STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 17, 2022
Mecosta/Osceola Youth Attention Center
Room 134
126 Maple St., Suite F
Big Rapids, MI 49307
RE: License #: CB540201289
Mecosta/Osceola Youth Attention Center
Room 134
126 Maple St., Suite F
Big Rapids, MI 49307
Dear Ms. Eddinger:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
May 17, 2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes and rules. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rules.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(h) Documentation from the department that the person has
not been named in a central registry case as the perpetrator of
child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in any state where the
person lived in the 5 years preceding hire.
Two of four employee files reviewed contained documentation that Central Registry
clearances were requested however there is no documentation the Central Registry
clearance results were received prior to hire as required.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
This facility is non-contracted therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
The facility is not a local MDHHS office nor does the facility have a MDHHS
contract, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
 Recommendation to utilize an HR checklist or update existing checklist to ensure
all required activities are completed prior to hiring an individual.
 Social work contacts should include the location of the meeting with youth.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect,
substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing period.
4

The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reported no barriers to achieving compliance
over the past review period. The Chief Administrator noted no citations in the previous
year audit and is confident the agency will be able to continue that trend.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff: one face-to-face at the agency and one via
telephone. Staff acknowledged this year has had some challenges related to extra
documentation needed to satisfy the variety of funding source requirements. In
addition, staff report a higher than usual number of referrals to the program has
created a waiting list. However, they feel hopeful they will continue to adjust as
needed. Staff reported feeling supported by supervision as well as coworkers and did
not report any areas of need.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
___________5/17/2022___________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 17, 2022

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
